moves.7... dxc4: This leaves book for the last time.
moves.8. Bxc4 Bb4 9. a3 Bxc3+ 10. bxc3 Ne4: This is the first of the inaccuracies the computer gave black.
moves.11... c5 12. O-O: The computer gives my advantage at 1.25.
moves.12... cxd4 13. cxd4: I have stronger central control, and a lead in development.
moves.13... b6 14. Bd3: Trying to force away the knight.
moves.14... Bb7: Fianchettoes and defends the knight at the same time.
moves.15. Qc2 Nf6: His knight is forced to retreat
moves.16. Bg5 h6 17. Bxf6 Qxf6 18. Be4: I am getting tired of him having his bishop on that long diagonal.
moves.19. Qxe4: My queen sits happily in the middle of the board. Computer puts me at + 1.99.
moves.20... Qd8: Let's take stock of this position. Pawn structure: Both sides have two pawn islands, but one of white's is isolated. Black is slightly better in pawn structure. Piece activity: None of black's pieces are farther than the seventh rank. Black is extremely passive, and white is better in piece activity. Material: equal. Central control: White almost exclusively controls the center.
moves.21. Rfc1 Nf6 22. Qc6: I triple up on the c column.
moves.25. Qxc8 Qxc8 26. Rxc8 Rxc8: We now find ourselves in a relatively equal endgame. Computer puts me up by + 0.37.
moves.27... f6 28. Ng6 Kh7 29. Nf4: In retrospect, it would have been better to move it to e7, as here he can double my pawns with a capture.
moves.32. Ra6: Looking to trade off my weak doubled pawn on f4,
moves.34. g4 f5 35. Kg3 Kg6 36. gxf5+ Kxf5: Looking at this position I didn't think either player could really win, so I offered a draw.
moves.37... Rb3+: This looks really strong, at it appears to force my king downward where his king can take my pawn. But he overlooked a defense.
moves.38. f3 Rb1 39. a4: I look to trade off our isolated pawns
moves.39... Rb4 40. a5 bxa5 41. Rxa5+: I take his pawn with check
moves.42. Kg4: And I take the opposition. This was enough for my opponent to offer a draw, as he though having my king advanced and his pushed back was enough to compensate for my doubled pawns.
moves.42... Rb1: Game is drawn. It wasn't a particularly exciting game, but it made me pretty happy because I made no computer recognizable errors.
